abstract.text: Channel Voice events include notes, continuous controllers, pressure (aftertouch), program changes, and registered parameters (RPN/NRPN). Additional per-note controllers are available when communicating with a device that supports MIDI 2.0.

System Common events include general system messages such as song select and MIDI Timecode (MTC) quarter-frame. These messages are not channel-specific.

Channel Voice Message: RPN (Registered Parameter Number),
also referred to as Registered Controller in MIDI 2.0.

System Exclusive messages carry a header and an arbitrary number of data bytes. These messages are typically used to communicate patch and preset data or binary data payloads such as raw audio samples or device firmware updates. It is up to each software or hardware manufacturer to determine how the data is formatted.
